劉.definition: (classical) a type of battle-ax; to kill; to slaughter

劉伯溫.definition: Liu Bowen (1311-1375), general under the first Ming emperor Zhu Yuanzhang 朱元璋[Zhu1 Yuan2 zhang1], with a reputation as a military genius, also called Liu Ji 劉基|刘基[Liu2 Ji1]

劉備.definition: Liu Bei (161-223), warlord at the end of the Han dynasty and founder of the Han kingdom of Shu 蜀漢|蜀汉 (c. 200-263), later the Shu Han dynasty

劉光第.definition: Liu Guangdi (1859-1898), one of the Six Gentlemen Martyrs 戊戌六君子[Wu4 xu1 Liu4 jun1 zi5] of the unsuccessful reform movement of 1898

劉公島.definition: Liugong island in the Yellow sea

劉劍峰.definition: Liu Jianfeng (1936-), second governor of Hainan

劉厚總.definition: Liu Houzong (1904-1949), originally Hunan guerilla leader, rewarded by Chiang Kaishek for killing Xiang Ying 項英|项英[Xiang4 Ying1] during the 1941 New Fourth Army incident 皖南事變|皖南事变[Wan3 nan2 Shi4 bian4]

劉向.definition: Liu Xiang (77-6 BC), Han Dynasty scholar and author

劉基.definition: Liu Ji or Liu Bowen 劉伯溫|刘伯温[Liu2 Bo2 wen1] (1311-1375), general under the first Ming emperor Zhu Yuanzhang 朱元璋[Zhu1 Yuan2 zhang1], with a reputation as a military genius

劉天華.definition: Liu Tianhua (1895-1932), Chinese musician and composer

劉奭.definition: Liu Shi, personal name of Han Emperor Yuandi 漢元帝|汉元帝[Han4 Yuan2 di4]

劉姥姥進大觀園.pinyin: liú lǎo lǎo jìn dà guān yuán
劉姥姥進大觀園.definition: Granny Liu visits the Grand View gardens; (of a simple person) to be overwhelmed by new experiences and luxurious surroundings

劉安.definition: Liu An (179-122 BC), King of Huainan under the Western Han, ordered the writing of the 淮南子[Huai2 nan2 zi5]

劉宋.definition: Song of the Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479), with capital at Nanjing

劉宋時代.definition: Song of the Southern dynasties (420-479), with capital at Nanjing

劉家村.definition: Liujia village in Zhangdian District 張店區|张店区[Zhang1 dian4 Qu1] of Zhibo city 淄博市[Zi1 bo2 shi4], Shandong

劉家輝.definition: Gordon Liu (1955-), Hong Kong action actor

劉少奇.definition: Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution

劉師培.definition: Liu Shipei (1884-1919), Chinese anarchist and revolutionary activist

劉德華.definition: Andy Lau (1961-), Hong Kong Cantopop singer and actor

劉恆.definition: Liu Heng, personal name of Han emperor Han Wendi 漢文帝|汉文帝; Liu Heng (1954-), Chinese writer

劉慈欣.definition: Liu Cixin (1963-), Chinese science fiction writer

劉昫.definition: Liu Xu (887-946), politician in Later Jin of the Five Dynasties 後晉|后晋[Hou4 Jin4], compiled History of Early Tang Dynasty 舊唐書|旧唐书[Jiu4 Tang2 shu1]

劉曉波.definition: Liu Xiaobo (1955-2017), Beijing writer and human rights activist, organizer of petition Charter 2008 零八憲章|零八宪章[Ling2 ba1 Xian4 zhang1], Nobel Peace Prize laureate in 2010

劉松齡.definition: Ferdinand Augustin Hallerstein (1703-1774), Slovenian Jesuit missionary, astronomer and mathematician, spent 35 years at Emperor Qianlong's court

劉毅.definition: Liu Yi (-285), famous incorruptible official of Western Jin dynasty the Western Jin dynasty 西晉|西晋[Xi1 Jin4] (265-316); Liu Yi (-412), general of Eastern Jin dynasty 東晉|东晋[Dong1 Jin4] (317-420)

劉洋.definition: Liu Yang (1978-), China's first female astronaut in space (June 16, 2012)

劉涓子.definition: Liu Juanzi, legendary alchemist and creator of magic potions

劉涓子鬼遺方.pinyin: liú juān zi guǐ yí fāng
劉涓子鬼遺方.definition: Liu Juanzi's medical recipes bequeathed by the ghost Huang Fugui 黃父鬼|黄父鬼

劉淵.definition: Liu Yuan (c. 251-310), warlord at the end of the Western Jin dynasty 西晉|西晋[Xi1 Jin4], founder of Cheng Han of the Sixteen Kingdoms 成漢|成汉[Cheng2 Han4] (304-347)

劉熙.definition: Liu Xi (late Han, c. 200 AD), possibly the author of 釋名|释名[Shi4 ming2]

劉禪.definition: Liu Shan (207-271), son of Liu Bei, reigned as Shu Han emperor 233-263; Taiwan pr. [Liu2 Chan2]

劉義慶.definition: Liu Yiqing (403-444), writer of South Song Dynasty, compiler and editor of A New Account of the Tales of the World 世說新語|世说新语[Shi4 shuo1 Xin1 yu3]

劉翔.definition: Liu Xiang (1983-), Chinese gold-medal hurdler of the 2004 Olympic Games

劉裕.definition: Liu Yu, founder of Song of the Southern dynasties 劉宋|刘宋[Liu2 Song4], broke away from Eastern Jin in 420, reigned as Emperor Wu of Song 宋武帝[Song4 Wu3 di4]

劉貴今.definition: Liu Guijin (1945-), PRC diplomat, special representative to Africa from 2007, Chinese specialist on Sudan and the Darfur issue

劉賓雁.definition: Liu Binyan (1925-2005), journalist and novelist, condemned by Mao as rightist faction in 1957, subsequently dissident writer

劉邦.definition: Liu Bang (256 or 247-195 BC), bandit leader who became first Han emperor Han Gaozu 漢高祖|汉高祖 (reigned 202-195 BC)

劉金寶.definition: Liu Jinbao (1952-), CEO of the Bank of China (Hong Kong) 1997-2003, jailed after being convicted of embezzlement

劉雲山.definition: Liu Yunshan (1947-), PRC politician, background in journalism in Inner Mongolia, head of the Central Propaganda Department 2002-2012

劉鶚.definition: Liu E (1857-1909), late Qing novelist, author of 老殘遊記|老残游记[Lao3 Can2 You2 ji4]
